018package org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder;

020import static java.util.Locale.ROOT;
021import static java.util.regex.Pattern.compile;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.CommonConstants.EMPTY_STRING;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.isNull;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
027import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
028import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.isNotEmptyOrBlank;
029import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.splitString;
030import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_AttributeName;
031import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_ElementName;
032import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_NMToken;
033import static org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.builder.XMLBuilderUtils.Validator.VALIDATOR_Prefix;
034
035import java.io.IOException;
036import java.io.Serial;
037import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;

059/**
060 *  A collection of XML related utility methods and factory methods for XML
061 *  elements.
062 *
063 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
064 *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
065 *  @since 0.0.5
066 *
067 *  @UMLGraph.link
068 */
069@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
070@UtilityClass
071@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
072@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
073public final class XMLBuilderUtils
074{
075        /*---------------*\
076    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
077        \*---------------*/
078    /**
079     *  The (default) validators.
080     *
081     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
082     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
083     *  @since 0.0.5
084     *
085     *  @UMLGraph.link
086     */
087    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
088    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
089    public enum Validator
090    {
091            /*------------------*\
092        ====** Enum Declaration **=============================================
093            \*------------------*/
094        /**
095         *  The attribute name validator.
096         */
097        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
098        VALIDATOR_AttributeName( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName, XMLBuilderUtils::getAttributeNameValidator ),
099
100        /**
101         *  The element name validator.
102         */
103        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
104        VALIDATOR_ElementName( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName, XMLBuilderUtils::getElementNameValidator ),
105
106        /**
107         *  The nmtoken validator.
108         */
109        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
110        VALIDATOR_NMToken( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken, XMLBuilderUtils::getNMTokenValidator ),
111
112        /**
113         *  The namespace prefix validator.
114         */
115        @SuppressWarnings( "synthetic-access" )
116        VALIDATOR_Prefix( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix, XMLBuilderUtils::getPrefixValidator );
117
118            /*------------*\
119        ====** Attributes **===================================================
120            \*------------*/
121        /**
122         *  The method that retrieves the current validator.
123         */
124        @SuppressWarnings( {"NonFinalFieldInEnum", "FieldMayBeFinal"} )
125        private Supplier<? extends Predicate<CharSequence>> m_CurrentValidatorSupplier;
126
127        /**
128         *  The default validator.
129         */
130        @SuppressWarnings( {"FieldMayBeFinal", "NonFinalFieldInEnum"} )
131        private Predicate<CharSequence> m_DefaultValidator;
132
133            /*--------------*\
134        ====** Constructors **=================================================
135            \*--------------*/
136        /**
137         *  Creates a new {@code Validator} instance.
138         *
139         *  @param  defaultValidator    The default validator.
140         *  @param  currentValidatorSupplier    The method that retrieves the
141         *      current validator.
142         */
143        private Validator( final Predicate<CharSequence> defaultValidator, final Supplier<? extends Predicate<CharSequence>> currentValidatorSupplier )
144        {
145            m_CurrentValidatorSupplier = currentValidatorSupplier;
146            m_DefaultValidator = defaultValidator;
147        }   //  Validator()
148
149            /*---------*\
150        ====** Methods **======================================================
151            \*---------*/
152        /**
153         *  Returns the current validator.
154         *
155         *  @return The current validator.
156         */
157        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getCurrent() { return m_CurrentValidatorSupplier.get(); }
158
159        /**
160         *  Returns the default validator.
161         *
162         *  @return The default validator.
163         */
164        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getDefault() { return m_DefaultValidator; }
165    }
166    //  enum Validator
167
168    /**
169     *  The
170     *  {@link EventObject}
171     *  for changes to the validator configuration.
172     *
173     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
174     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
175     *  @since 0.0.5
176     *
177     *  @UMLGraph.link
178     */
179    @SuppressWarnings( "PublicInnerClass" )
180    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
181    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
182    public static class ValidatorChangeEvent extends EventObject
183    {
184            /*------------------------*\
185        ====** Static Initialisations **=======================================
186            \*------------------------*/
187        /**
188         *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
189         *
190         *  @hidden
191         */
192        @Serial
193        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
194
195            /*------------*\
196        ====** Attributes **===================================================
197            \*------------*/
198        /**
199         *  The new validator.
200         */
201        private final Predicate<CharSequence> m_NewValidator;
202
203        /**
204         *  The previous validator.
205         */
206        private final Predicate<CharSequence> m_OldValidator;
207
208        /**
209         *  The validator that changed.
210         */
211        private final Validator m_Validator;
212
213            /*--------------*\
214        ====** Constructors **=================================================
215            \*--------------*/
216        /**
217         *  Creates a new {@code ValidatorChangeEvent} instance.
218         *
219         *  @param  validator   The validator that changed.
220         *  @param  oldValidator    The previous validator.
221         *  @param  newValidator    The new validator.
222         */
223        ValidatorChangeEvent( final Validator validator, final Predicate<CharSequence> oldValidator, final Predicate<CharSequence> newValidator )
224        {
225            super( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
226            m_Validator = validator;
227            m_OldValidator = oldValidator;
228            m_NewValidator = newValidator;
229        }   //  ValidatorChangeEvent()
230
231            /*---------*\
232        ====** Methods **======================================================
233            \*---------*/
234        /**
235         *  Returns the new validator.
236         *
237         *  @return The new validator.
238         */
239        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getNewValidator() { return m_NewValidator; }
240
241        /**
242         *  Returns the previous validator.
243         *
244         *  @return The old validator.
245         */
246        public final Predicate<CharSequence> getOldValidator() { return m_OldValidator; }
247
248        /**
249         *  Gets the validator that was changed.
250         *
251         *  @return The changed validator.
252         */
253        public final Validator getValidator() { return m_Validator; }
254    }
255    //  class ValidatorChangeEvent
256
257    /**
258     *  The interface for listeners to
259     *  {@link ValidatorChangeEvent}s
260     *
261     *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
262     *  @version $Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
263     *  @since 0.0.5
264     *
265     *  @UMLGraph.link
266     */
267    @FunctionalInterface
268    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: XMLBuilderUtils.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
269    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
270    public static interface ValidatorChangeListener
271    {
272            /*---------*\
273        ====** Methods **======================================================
274            \*---------*/
275        /**
276         *  This method gets called each time a validator changes.
277         *
278         *  @param  event   The change event.
279         */
280        @SuppressWarnings( "UseOfConcreteClass" )
281        public void validatorChanged( final ValidatorChangeEvent event );
282    }
283    //  interface ValidatorChangeListener
284
285        /*-----------*\
286    ====** Constants **========================================================
287        \*-----------*/
288    /**
289     *  The regular expression for a valid start character of an XML name.
290     *  Usually, the colon (':') is also allowed, but for namespace
291     *  aware parsers, this is used as the separator between the namespace
292     *  prefix and the name itself.
293     */
294    private static final String XML_NAME_FirstChar = """
295        A-Z_a-z\
296        \\u00C0-\\u00D6\\u00D8-\\u00F6\\u00F8-\\u02FF\\u0370-\\u037D\
297        \\u037F-\\u1FFF\\u200C-\\u200D\\u2070-\\u218F\\u2C00-\\u2FEF\
298        \\u3001-\\uD7FF\\uF900-\\uFDCF\\uFDF0-\\uFFFD\\x{10000}-\\x{EFFFF}""";
299
300    /**
301     *  The regular expression for a character that is valid for an XML after
302     *  the first character. Usually, the colon (':') is also allowed, but for
303     *  namespace aware parsers, this is used as the separator between the
304     *  namespace prefix and the name itself.
305     */
306    private static final String XML_NAME_OtherChar = "-"
307        + XML_NAME_FirstChar
308        + ".0-9\\u00B7\\u0300-\\u036F\\u203F-\\u2040";
309
310        /*------------*\
311    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
312        \*------------*/
313    /**
314     *  The validator change listeners.
315     */
316    private static final Collection<WeakReference<ValidatorChangeListener>> m_ValidatorChangeListeners = new ArrayList<>();
317
318        /*------------------------*\
319    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
320        \*------------------------*/
321    /**
322     *  The method that validates an XML attribute name.
323     */
324    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_AttributeNameValidator = new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName );
325
326    /**
327     *  The method that validates an XML element name.
328     */
329    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_ElementNameValidator = new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName );
330
331    /**
332     *  The pattern that is used to validate a nmtoken.
333     */
334    private static final Pattern m_NMTokenPattern;
335
336    /**
337     *  The method that validates an XML nmtoken.
338     */
339    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_NMTokenValidator =  new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken );
340
341    /**
342     *  The method that validates an XML namespace prefix.
343     */
344    private static final AtomicReference<Predicate<CharSequence>> m_PrefixValidator =  new AtomicReference<>( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix );
345
346    /**
347     *  The pattern that is used to validate an XML name.
348     */
349    private static final Pattern m_XMLNamePattern;
350
351    static
352    {
353        //---* Defines the patterns for the validation *-----------------------
354        try
355        {
356            //noinspection RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup
357            m_NMTokenPattern = compile( "(?:[" + XML_NAME_FirstChar + "])(?:[" + XML_NAME_OtherChar + ":])*" );
358            //noinspection RegExpUnnecessaryNonCapturingGroup
359            m_XMLNamePattern = compile( "(?:[" + XML_NAME_FirstChar + "])(?:[" + XML_NAME_OtherChar + "])*" );
360        }
361        catch( final PatternSyntaxException e )
362        {
363            throw new ExceptionInInitializerError( e );
364        }
365    }
366
367        /*--------------*\
368    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
369        \*--------------*/
370    /**
371     *  No instance allowed for this class.
372     */
373    private XMLBuilderUtils() { throw new PrivateConstructorForStaticClassCalledError( XMLBuilderUtils.class ); }
374
375        /*---------*\
376    ====** Methods **==========================================================
377        \*---------*/
378    /**
379     *  Adds a validator change listener.
380     *
381     *  @param  listener    The listener.
382     */
383    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
384    public static final void addValidatorChangeListener( final ValidatorChangeListener listener )
385    {
386        final var reference = new WeakReference<>( requireNonNullArgument( listener, "listener" ) );
387        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
388        {
389            m_ValidatorChangeListeners.add( reference );
390        }
391    }   //  addValidatorChangeListener()
392
393    /**
394     *  Composes the
395     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}
396     *  for the XML file header.
397     *
398     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the resulting document.
399     *  @param  standalone  {@code true} if the XML document is standalone,
400     *      {@code false} if not.
401     *  @return The new processing instruction.
402     */
403    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
404    public static final ProcessingInstruction composeXMLHeader( final Charset encoding, final boolean standalone )
405    {
406        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl();
407        retValue.setAttribute( "version", "1.0" );
408        retValue.setAttribute( "encoding", requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ).name() );
409        retValue.setAttribute( "standalone", standalone ? "yes" : "no" );
410
411        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
412        return retValue;
413    }   //  composeXMLHeader()
414
415    /**
416     *  Creates a
417     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
418     *
419     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
420     *  @return The new processing instruction.
421     */
422    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
423    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final String elementName )
424    {
425        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl( elementName );
426
427        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
428        return retValue;
429    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
430
431    /**
432     *  Creates a
433     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
434     *
435     *  @param  parent  The document that owns the new procession instruction.
436     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
437     *  @return The new processing instruction.
438     */
439    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
440    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final XMLDocument parent, final String elementName )
441    {
442        final var retValue = createProcessingInstruction( elementName );
443        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addProcessingInstruction( retValue );
444
445        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
446        return retValue;
447    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
448
449    /**
450     *  Creates a
451     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
452     *
453     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
454     *  @param  data    The data for the processing instruction.
455     *  @return The new processing instruction.
456     */
457    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
458    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final String elementName, final CharSequence data )
459    {
460        final var retValue = new ProcessingInstructionImpl( elementName, data );
461
462        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
463        return retValue;
464    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
465
466    /**
467     *  Creates a
468     *  {@link ProcessingInstruction}.
469     *
470     *  @param  parent  The document that owns the new procession instruction.
471     *  @param  elementName The name for the processing instruction.
472     *  @param  data    The data for the processing instruction.
473     *  @return The new processing instruction.
474     */
475    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
476    public static final ProcessingInstruction createProcessingInstruction( final XMLDocument parent, final String elementName, final CharSequence data )
477    {
478        final var retValue = createProcessingInstruction( elementName, data );
479        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addProcessingInstruction( retValue );
480
481        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
482        return retValue;
483    }   //  createProcessingInstruction()
484
485    /**
486     *  Creates an XML document that will not have an explicit doc type, the
487     *  root element will be {@code <root>}. The encoding is defined as
488     *  UTF-8.<br>
489     *  <br>Basically, this document would have the DTD
490     *  <pre><code>&lt;!ELEMENT root ANY&gt;</code></pre>.<br>
491     *  <br>The root element allows attributes and children, but will not
492     *  validate them. It also allows text.
493     *
494     *  @return The new XML document.
495     */
496    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
497    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument() { return new XMLDocumentImpl(); }
498
499    /**
500     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element name for the root
501     *  element.<br>
502     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
503     *  provided by
504     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
505     *  <br>The created root element allows attributes and children, but will
506     *  not validate them. It also allows text.
507     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.
508     *
509     *  @param  elementName The element name.
510     *  @return The new XML document.
511     */
512    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
513    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final String elementName )
514    {
515        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
516    }   //  createXMLDocument()
517
518    /**
519     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
520     *  element.
521     *
522     *  @param  rootElement The root element.
523     *  @return The new XML document.
524     */
525    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
526    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement )
527    {
528        return createXMLDocument( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), true );
529    }   //  createXMLDocument()
530
531    /**
532     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
533     *  element.
534     *
535     *  @param  rootElement The root element.
536     *  @param  standalone  {@code true} for a standalone document,
537     *      {@code false} otherwise.
538     *  @return The new XML document.
539     */
540    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
541    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final boolean standalone )
542    {
543        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), standalone );
544    }   //  createXMLDocument()
545
546    /**
547     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
548     *  element with the given encoding and DTD.
549     *
550     *  @param  rootElement The root element for this document.
551     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the new XML document.
552     *  @param  name    The name for the DTD.
553     *  @param  uri The URI for the DTD.
554     *  @return The new XML document.
555     */
556    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
557    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final Charset encoding, final String name, final URI uri )
558    {
559        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ), requireNotEmptyArgument( name, "name" ), requireNonNullArgument( uri, "uri" ) );
560    }   //  createXMLDocument()
561
562    /**
563     *  Creates an XML document that uses the given element for the root
564     *  element with the given encoding and DTD.
565     *
566     *  @param  rootElement The root element for this document.
567     *  @param  encoding    The encoding for the new XML document.
568     *  @param  uri The URI for the DTD.
569     *  @return The new XML document.
570     */
571    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
572    public static final XMLDocument createXMLDocument( final XMLElement rootElement, final Charset encoding, final URI uri )
573    {
574        return new XMLDocumentImpl( requireNonNullArgument( rootElement, "rootElement" ), requireNonNullArgument( encoding, "encoding" ), requireNonNullArgument( uri, "uri" ) );
575    }   //  createXMLDocument()
576
577    /**
578     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
579     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments.<br>
580     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
581     *  provided by
582     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
583     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
584     *  validate them. It also allows text.
585     *
586     *  @param  elementName The element name.
587     *  @return The new XML element.
588     */
589    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
590    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName )
591    {
592        return new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
593    }   //  createXMLElement()
594
595    /**
596     *  <p>{@summary Creates an XML element for the given element name that
597     *  supports attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and
598     *  comments, and add the given text.}</p>
599     *  <p>The given element name is validated using the method that is
600     *  provided by
601     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.</p>
602     *  <p>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
603     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).</p>
604     *
605     *  @param  elementName The element name.
606     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
607     *  @return The new XML element.
608     */
609    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
610    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final CharSequence text )
611    {
612        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
613        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
614
615        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
616        return retValue;
617    }   //  createXMLElement()
618
619    /**
620     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
621     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments, and
622     *  adds it as child to the given parent.<br>
623     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
624     *  provided by
625     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
626     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
627     *  validate them. It also allows text.
628     *
629     *  @param  elementName The element name.
630     *  @param  parent  The parent element.
631     *  @return The new XML element.
632     */
633    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
634    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLElement parent )
635    {
636        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
637        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
638
639        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
640        return retValue;
641    }   //  createXMLElement()
642
643    /**
644     *  Creates an XML element for the given element name that supports
645     *  attributes, namespaces, children, text, {@code CDATA} and comments,
646     *  adds the given text, and adds it as child to the given parent.<br>
647     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
648     *  provided by
649     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
650     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
651     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).
652     *
653     *  @param  elementName The element name.
654     *  @param  parent  The parent element.
655     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
656     *  @return The new XML element.
657     */
658    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
659    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLElement parent, final CharSequence text )
660    {
661        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
662        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
663        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
664
665        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
666        return retValue;
667    }   //  createXMLElement()
668
669    /**
670     *  Creates an XML element for the given tag and adds it as child to the
671     *  given document.<br>
672     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
673     *  provided by
674     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
675     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
676     *  validate them. It also allows text.
677     *
678     *  @param  elementName The element name.
679     *  @param  parent  The document.
680     *  @return The new XML element.
681     */
682    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
683    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLDocument parent )
684    {
685        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
686        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
687
688        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
689        return retValue;
690    }   //  createXMLElement()
691
692    /**
693     *  Creates an XML element for the given tag and with the given text, and
694     *  adds it as child to the given document.<br>
695     *  <br>The given element name is validated using the method that is
696     *  provided by
697     *  {@link #getElementNameValidator()}.<br>
698     *  <br>The new element allows attributes and children, but will not
699     *  validate them. It also allows text (obviously).
700     *
701     *  @param  elementName The element name.
702     *  @param  parent  The document.
703     *  @param  text    The text for the new element.
704     *  @return The new XML element.
705     */
706    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
707    public static final XMLElement createXMLElement( final String elementName, final XMLDocument parent, final CharSequence text )
708    {
709        final XMLElement retValue = new XMLElementImpl( requireNotEmptyArgument( elementName, "elementName" ) );
710        retValue.addText( requireNonNullArgument( text, "text" ) );
711        requireNonNullArgument( parent, "parent" ).addChild( retValue );
712
713        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
714        return retValue;
715    }   //  createXMLElement()
716
717    /**
718     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities.<br>
719     *  <br>For example:<br>
720     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
721     *  <br>becomes:<br>
722     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
723     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.<br>
724     *  <br>Delegates to
725     *  {@link StringUtils#escapeXML(CharSequence)}.
726     *
727     *  @param  str The {@code String} to escape, may be null.
728     *  @return A new escaped {@code String}, or {@code null} if the
729     *      argument was already {@code null}.
730     *
731     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
732     */
733    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
734    public static String escapeXML( final CharSequence str ) { return StringUtils.escapeXML( str ); }
735
736    /**
737     *  Escapes the characters in a {@code String} using XML entities and
738     *  writes them to an
739     *  {@link Appendable}.<br>
740     *  <br>For example:<br>
741     *  <br>{@code "bread" & "butter"}<br>
742     *  <br>becomes:<br>
743     *  <br><code>&amp;quot;bread&amp;quot; &amp;amp;
744     *  &amp;quot;butter&amp;quot;</code>.<br>
745     *  <br>Delegates to
746     *  {@link StringUtils#escapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)}.
747     *
748     *  @param  appendable  The appendable object receiving the escaped string.
749     *  @param  str  The {@code String} to escape, may be {@code null}.
750     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The appendable is {@code null}.
751     *  @throws IOException when {@code Appendable} passed throws the exception
752     *      from calls to the
753     *      {@link Appendable#append(char)}
754     *      method.
755     *
756     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
757     *  @see #unescapeXML(CharSequence)
758     */
759    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
760    public static void escapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
761    {
762        StringUtils.escapeXML( appendable, str );
763    }   //  escapeXML()
764
765    /**
766     *  Returns the method to validate attribute names.
767     *
768     *  @return The validator method.
769     */
770    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
771    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getAttributeNameValidator() { return m_AttributeNameValidator.get(); }
772
773    /**
774     *  Returns the method to validate element names.
775     *
776     *  @return The validator method.
777     */
778    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
779    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getElementNameValidator() { return m_ElementNameValidator.get(); }
780
781    /**
782     *  Returns the method to validate {@code nmtoken}s.
783     *
784     *  @return The validator method.
785     */
786    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
787    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getNMTokenValidator() { return m_NMTokenValidator.get(); }
788
789    /**
790     *  Returns the method to validate prefixes.
791     *
792     *  @return The validator method.
793     */
794    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
795    public static final Predicate<CharSequence> getPrefixValidator() { return m_PrefixValidator.get(); }
796
797    /**
798     *  The default implementation for an attribute name validator.
799     *
800     *  @param  attributeName   The name to test.
801     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid, {@code false}
802     *  otherwise.
803     *
804     *  @see #getAttributeNameValidator()
805     */
806    private static final boolean isValidAttributeName( final CharSequence attributeName )
807    {
808        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( attributeName );
809        if( retValue )
810        {
811            var attribute = EMPTY_STRING;
812            final var parts = splitString( attributeName, ':' );
813            switch( parts.length )
814            {
815                //  No namespace prefix.
816                case 1 -> attribute = parts[0];
817                //  Namespace prefix.
818                case 2 ->
819                {
820                    attribute = parts[1];
821                    retValue = getPrefixValidator().test( parts[0] );
822                }
823                // More than one colon
824                default -> retValue = false;
825            }
826            if( retValue && (attribute.length() >= 3) ) retValue = !attribute.toLowerCase( ROOT ).startsWith( "xml" );
827            if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( attribute ).matches();
828        }
829
830        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
831        return retValue;
832    }   //  isValidAttributeName()
833
834    /**
835     *  The default implementation for an element name validator.
836     *
837     *  @param  elementName   The name to test.
838     *  @return {@code true} if the given name is valid, {@code false}
839     *  otherwise.
840     *
841     *  @see #getElementNameValidator()
842     */
843    private static final boolean isValidElementName( final CharSequence elementName )
844    {
845        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( elementName );
846        if( retValue )
847        {
848            var element = EMPTY_STRING;
849            final var parts = splitString( elementName, ':' );
850            switch( parts.length )
851            {
852                //  No namespace prefix.
853                case 1 -> element = parts[0];
854                //  Namespace prefix.
855                case 2 ->
856                {
857                    element = parts[1];
858                    retValue = getPrefixValidator().test( parts[0] );
859                }
860                // More than one colon
861                default -> retValue = false;
862            }
863            if( retValue && (element.length() >= 3) ) retValue = !element.toLowerCase( ROOT ).startsWith( "xml" );
864            if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( element ).matches();
865        }
866
867        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
868        return retValue;
869    }   //  isValidElementName()
870
871    /**
872     *  The default implementation for an NMToken validator.
873     *
874     *  @param  nmtoken   The NMToken to test.
875     *  @return {@code true} if the given NMToke is valid, {@code false}
876     *  otherwise.
877     *
878     *  @see #getNMTokenValidator()
879     */
880    private static final boolean isValidNMToken( final CharSequence nmtoken )
881    {
882        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( nmtoken );
883        if( retValue ) retValue = m_NMTokenPattern.matcher( nmtoken ).matches();
884
885        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
886        return retValue;
887    }   //  isValidNMToken()
888
889    /**
890     *  The default implementation for a prefix validator.
891     *
892     *  @param  prefix  The prefix to test.
893     *  @return {@code true} if the given prefix is valid, {@code false}
894     *  otherwise.
895     *
896     *  @see #getPrefixValidator()
897     */
898    private static final boolean isValidPrefix( final CharSequence prefix )
899    {
900        var retValue = isNotEmptyOrBlank( prefix );
901        if( retValue ) retValue = m_XMLNamePattern.matcher( prefix ).matches();
902
903        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
904        return retValue;
905    }   //  isValidPrefix()
906
907    /**
908     *  Removes the given validator change listener.
909     *
910     *  @param  listener    The listener to remove.
911     */
912    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
913    public static final void removeValidatorChangeListener( final ValidatorChangeListener listener )
914    {
915        if( nonNull( listener ) )
916        {
917            synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
918            {
919                var removed = false;
920                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
921                {
922                    final var current = reference.get();
923                    if( isNull( current ) )
924                    {
925                        removed = true;
926                    }
927                    else if( current == listener )
928                    {
929                        reference.clear();
930                        removed = true;
931                    }
932                }
933
934                //---* House keeping: get rid of the dead references *---------
935                if( removed ) m_ValidatorChangeListeners.removeIf( r -> isNull( r.get() ) );
936            }
937        }
938    }   //  removeValidatorChangeListener()
939
940    /**
941     *  Sets the validators back to the default configuration. The current
942     *  validators are abandoned.
943     *
944     *  @see #getAttributeNameValidator()
945     *  @see #getElementNameValidator()
946     *  @see #getNMTokenValidator()
947     *  @see #getPrefixValidator()
948     *  @see #setAttributeNameValidator(Predicate)
949     *  @see #setElementNameValidator(Predicate)
950     *  @see #setNMTokenValidator(Predicate)
951     *  @see #setPrefixValidator(Predicate)
952     */
953    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
954    public static final void restoreDefaultValidators()
955    {
956        //---* Set the validator methods *-------------------------------------
957        setAttributeNameValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidAttributeName );
958        setElementNameValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidElementName );
959        setNMTokenValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidNMToken );
960        setPrefixValidator( XMLBuilderUtils::isValidPrefix );
961    }   //  restoreDefaultValidators()
962
963    /**
964     *  Sets the method to validate attribute names.
965     *
966     *  @param  validator The validator method.
967     */
968    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
969    public static final void setAttributeNameValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
970    {
971        final var oldValidator = m_AttributeNameValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
972        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
973        {
974            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
975            {
976                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_AttributeName, oldValidator, validator );
977                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
978                {
979                    final var listener = reference.get();
980                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
981                }
982            }
983        }
984    }   //  setAttributeNameValidator()
985
986    /**
987     *  Sets the method to validate element names.
988     *
989     *  @param  validator The validator method.
990     */
991    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
992    public static final void setElementNameValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
993    {
994        final var oldValidator = m_ElementNameValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
995        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
996        {
997            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
998            {
999                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_ElementName, oldValidator, validator );
1000                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1001                {
1002                    final var listener = reference.get();
1003                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1004                }
1005            }
1006        }
1007    }   //  setElementNameValidator()
1008
1009    /**
1010     *  Sets the method to validate {@code nmtoken}s.
1011     *
1012     *  @param  validator The validator method.
1013     */
1014    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1015    public static final void setNMTokenValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
1016    {
1017        final var oldValidator = m_NMTokenValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
1018        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1019        {
1020            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
1021            {
1022                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_NMToken, oldValidator, validator );
1023                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1024                {
1025                    final var listener = reference.get();
1026                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1027                }
1028            }
1029        }
1030    }   //  setNMTokenValidator()
1031
1032    /**
1033     *  Sets the method to validate prefixes.
1034     *
1035     *  @param  validator The validator method.
1036     */
1037    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1038    public static final void setPrefixValidator( final Predicate<CharSequence> validator )
1039    {
1040        final var oldValidator = m_PrefixValidator.getAndSet( requireNonNullArgument( validator, "validator" ) );
1041        synchronized( m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1042        {
1043            if( !m_ValidatorChangeListeners.isEmpty() )
1044            {
1045                final var event = new ValidatorChangeEvent( VALIDATOR_Prefix, oldValidator, validator );
1046                for( final var reference : m_ValidatorChangeListeners )
1047                {
1048                    final var listener = reference.get();
1049                    if( nonNull( listener ) ) listener.validatorChanged( event );
1050                }
1051            }
1052        }
1053    }   //  setPrefixValidator()
1054
1055    /**
1056     *  Strips HTML or XML comments from the given String.<br>
1057     *  <br>Delegates to
1058     *  {@link StringUtils#stripXMLComments(CharSequence)}.
1059     *
1060     *  @param  s   The HTML/XML string.
1061     *  @return The string without the comments.
1062     */
1063    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1064    public static final String stripXMLComments( final CharSequence s ) { return StringUtils.stripXMLComments( s ); }
1065
1066    /**
1067     *  Unescapes an XML string containing XML entity escapes to a string
1068     *  containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the
1069     *  escapes.<br>
1070     *  <br>If an entity is unrecognised, it is left alone, and inserted
1071     *  verbatim into the result string. e.g. &quot;&amp;gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;
1072     *  will become &quot;&gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;.<br>
1073     *  <br>Delegates to
1074     *  {@link StringUtils#unescapeXML(CharSequence)}.
1075     *
1076     *  @param  str The {@code String} to unescape, may be {@code null}.
1077     *  @return A new unescaped {@code String}, {@code null} if the given
1078     *      string was already {@code null}.
1079     *
1080     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1081     *  @see #escapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)
1082     */
1083    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1084    public static final String unescapeXML( final CharSequence str ) { return StringUtils.unescapeXML( str ); }
1085
1086    /**
1087     *  Unescapes an XML String containing XML entity escapes to a String
1088     *  containing the actual Unicode characters corresponding to the escapes
1089     *  and writes it to the given
1090     *  {@link Appendable}.<br>
1091     *  <br>If an entity is unrecognised, it is left alone, and inserted
1092     *  verbatim into the result string. e.g. &quot;&amp;gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;
1093     *  will become &quot;&gt;&amp;zzzz;x&quot;.<br>
1094     *  <br>Delegates to
1095     *  {@link StringUtils#unescapeXML(Appendable,CharSequence)}.
1096     *
1097     *  @param  appendable  The appendable receiving the unescaped string.
1098     *  @param  str The {@code String} to unescape, may be {@code null}.
1099     *  @throws NullArgumentException   The writer is {@code null}.
1100     *  @throws IOException An IOException occurred.
1101     *
1102     *  @see #escapeXML(CharSequence)
1103     */
1104    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
1105    public static final void unescapeXML( final Appendable appendable, final CharSequence str ) throws IOException
1106    {
1107        StringUtils.unescapeXML( appendable, str );
1108    }   //  unescapeXML()
1109}
1110//  class XMLBuilderUtils
